p: A total of 102,020 cases were detected during 2012–2017 in Jiangsu Province, China, reaching an annual average incidence of 21.40 per 100,000. As shown in Fig. 1, the incidence exhibited an increasing long-term trend during these 6 years. Moreover, a distinct seasonality was exhibited, i.e., two incidence peaks were observed during each year: namely higher winter peak from December to February and a lower summer peak from July to September. The descriptive statistics for the meteorological factors were summarized in Table 1.
